children.text: There are sections of brickwork that are displaying greenish mould-like film on the face of the bricks.

There are a number of causes of this problem, the most common being too strong a concentration of hydrochloric acid during the initial cleaning process. Light coloured bricks contain vanadium salts which will react between the acid and the bricks if too strong an acid mix is used.
The Victorian Building Authority’s Guide to Standards and Tolerances clause 3.11, Cleaning, Mortar Smears & Stains states that
‘Stains, mortar smears and damage caused by cleaning are defects if they are visible from a normal viewing positioning’.
These areas should be properly re-cleaned with a product approved by the brick manufacturer to remove this staining, with care to ensure that the brickwork and mortar joints are not damaged.
